definition: croquet/goal ball (served by the goal keeper)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: A sport similar to the handball, called croquet, originally existed in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 地處中歐的德國原有類似手球的活動，稱爲門球。

sentences.english: Main characteristic of gate ball contest is order nature and cyclonite law.
sentences.chinese: 門球競賽的主要特點是順序性和週期性規律。

sentences.english: Participating in gateball improves communication within the family or community.
sentences.chinese: 參加門球活動可改善家庭和社區里人際交往。

sentences.english: Gateball is a sport with strong strategic elements and stimulates intellectual engagement .
sentences.chinese: 門球是帶有較強的戰術成分的運動，它激發智慧比拼。

sentences.english: How did gateball get so popular in Japan so quickly?
sentences.chinese: 門球是怎樣在日本迅速風靡起來的？

sentences.english: Try your skill at croquet, billiards and archery or spend an evening in the Card Room.
sentences.chinese: 嘗試在門球，檯球，射箭，或用在棋牌室一晚的技能。

sentences.english: There is a goal kick, the keeper kicks the ball.
sentences.chinese: 是個門球，守門員將球開出。
